Ingredients: 1 lb kimchi (sour and fermented), 8 oz pork belly or shoulder, 1/2 block of firm tofu, 1/2 onion, 2 green onions, 1 tbsp gochujang (Korean chili paste), 1 tbsp gochugaru (Korean chili flakes), 1 tsp minced garlic, 4 cups water or anchovy broth, 1 tsp sesame oil
Instructions: 1. Cut the pork into bite-sized pieces. Slice the onion and tofu. Chop the green onions. 2. In a pot, sauté the kimchi and pork with sesame oil for about 5 minutes until the pork is mostly cooked. 3. Add water or anchovy broth, gochujang, and gochugaru. Bring to a boil. 4. Reduce heat and let it simmer for 20-30 minutes to let the flavors meld. 5. Add the tofu and onion, and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the onion is translucent. 6. Stir in the minced garlic and chopped green onions. Serve hot with a bowl of rice.

Ingredients: 1 cup cooked rice, 4 oz beef (sirloin or ribeye), 1 carrot, 1 zucchini, 1 cup spinach, 1 cup bean sprouts, 4 shiitake mushrooms, 1 egg, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp minced garlic, 2 tsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp gochujang, Sesame seeds for garnish
Instructions: 1. Thinly slice the beef and marinate with soy sauce, garlic, and 1 tsp of sesame oil. 2. Julienne the carrot and zucchini. Slice the mushrooms. 3. Blanch the spinach and bean sprouts separately in boiling water, then shock in cold water. Squeeze out excess water and season each with a pinch of salt and a drizzle of sesame oil. 4. Sauté the carrot, zucchini, and mushrooms separately until tender-crisp. 5. Cook the marinated beef in the same pan until just done. 6. Fry an egg sunny-side up. 7. Assemble the bowl: place the hot cooked rice at the bottom. Arrange the prepared vegetables and beef neatly on top. Place the fried egg in the center. 8. Serve with gochujang on the side. To eat, mix everything together.

Ingredients: 1 lb beef (ribeye or sirloin), thinly sliced, 1/2 pear (grated), 1/4 cup soy sauce, 2 tbsp brown sugar, 1 tbsp minced garlic, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 green onion (chopped), 1 tsp minced ginger, Pinch of black pepper
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, combine the grated pear, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, sesame oil, green onion, ginger, and black pepper to make the marinade. 2. Add the thinly sliced beef to the marinade. Mix well to ensure every piece is coated. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight in the fridge for best results. 3. You can cook bulgogi on a grill, in a skillet, or on a griddle. Heat your cooking surface over medium-high heat. 4. Cook the beef in batches, searing it for a few minutes on each side until it's cooked through and slightly caramelized. 5. Garnish with more chopped green onion and sesame seeds. Serve immediately with rice and side dishes (banchan).

Ingredients: 8 oz sweet potato starch noodles (dangmyeon), 6 oz beef (sirloin), 1 carrot, 1/2 onion, 4-5 shiitake mushrooms, 1 cup spinach, 2 cloves garlic (minced), 4 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sugar, 2 tbsp sesame oil, Black pepper
Instructions: 1. Cook the sweet potato noodles in boiling water according to package directions (usually 6-8 minutes). Drain and rinse with cold water. Cut the noodles into shorter lengths with kitchen scissors. Toss with 1 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tbsp sesame oil. 2. Thinly slice the beef, onion, and mushrooms. Julienne the carrot. 3. Marinate the beef with 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1/2 tbsp sugar, and a pinch of black pepper. 4. Blanch the spinach, rinse in cold water, squeeze out excess water, and season with a pinch of salt. 5. In a large skillet, sauté the onion, carrots, and mushrooms separately until tender. Set aside. 6. Cook the marinated beef until done. 7. In the same large skillet (or a wok), combine the cooked noodles, all the prepared vegetables, and the beef. 8. Add the remaining 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1.5 tbsp sugar, minced garlic, and 1 tbsp sesame oil. Stir-fry over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, until everything is well-mixed and heated through. 9. Garnish with sesame seeds and serve warm or at room temperature.
